channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ID
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ID

item.title: Report X-2023111199
item.description:
Report X-2023111199

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AM QA discovered package leaking in unload. Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent. DescribePack: One of the caps of the bottles inside package was loose and 3 fl. oz. of the fluid spilled out of the box and got a side of the box wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent.

item.title: Report I-2023080072
item.description:
Report I-2023080072

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: JEROME
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Eastern Idaho Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During an FRA hazmat inspection the inspector found a loaded car with a leak from the manway. FRA Inspection - 7/10/2023 - ID# H1606 - Report No. 109 Car - NDYX 130009 A field inspection was conducted at the Eastern Idaho Railroad yard in Jerome, ID on July 10, 2023. The inspection was conducted to verify compliance with 49 CFR regulation requirements concerning the proper shipment of hazardous materials in 24 marked and placard railroad shipments. Subject tank car described as UN1202, Loaded with Diesel Fuel, Flammable, was identified during inspection releasing product from the manway. After discovering the release, General Manager Scott Presley was contacted and alerted to the situation. It was determined there wasn't an active leak.

  • Description: During an FRA hazmat inspection the inspector found a loaded car with a leak from the protective housing. FRA Inspection - 7/10/2023 - ID# H1606 - Report No. 109 Car - TCBX 198013 A field inspection was conducted at the Eastern Idaho Railroad yard in Jerome, ID on July 10, 2023. The inspection was conducted to verify compliance with 49 CFR regulation requirements concerning the proper shipment of hazardous materials in 24 marked and placard railroad shipments. Subject tank car described as UN1202, loaded with Diesel Fuel, Flammable, was identified during inspection releasing product from the manway. After discovering the release, General Manager Scott Presley was contacted and alerted to the situation. It was determined there wasn't an active leak.
